flashcards.title: DMV California Practice Flashcards - Set 5
flashcards.description: 15 essential DMV questions covering intersections, pedestrians, emergency situations, and safe driving practices for California driving test

cards.question: When you see this yellow sign, you should:
cards.answer: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk

cards.question: You must notify DMV within 5 days if you:
It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol consumption (BAC) that is ___ or higher.
You are driving 55 mph on a two-lane highway, one lane in each direction, and want to pass the car ahead of you. To pass safely, you need to:
cards.answer: have a large enough gap in the oncoming traffic

cards.question: If you approach an intersection without a stop sign or signals, you:
cards.answer: slow down and be ready to stop if necessary

cards.question: If a driver looks like he or she is going to pull out in front of you, the safest thing to do is:
cards.answer: slow or stop your car and use your horn

cards.question: When approaching a crosswalk where a blind pedestrian is waiting to cross, you must stop:
cards.answer: at the crosswalk and wait for the pedestrian to cross the street

cards.question: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching with a siren and flashing lights. You should:
cards.answer: continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop

cards.question: You must notify law enforcement and make a written report of traffic accident occurring in California (SR 1) to DMV if:
cards.answer: you are involved in a collision and there is a death

cards.question: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
Smoking inside a vehicle when a person younger than 18 years of age is present is:
You are stopped at an intersection. The traffic light just turned green. Should you go immediately?
cards.answer: yes, but yield to any vehicle or person still in the intersection

cards.question: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should:
cards.answer: let the call go to voicemail

cards.question: When driving near road work zones, you should:
cards.answer: pass the work zone carefully and avoid "rubbernecking"
